page.title: 15Religion in Whitley
page.content: {Church of England:}The present parish dates from l834 and use of the church_ yard from about l850.The small church is in brick with double Chancel, Nave, West Porch and turret with two bells. The roof is particularly beautiful.At Christmastime and other special days l25-130 people can be seated, although the congregation is usually 20-25. {The Society of Friends}have a meeting house in Frandley with a congregation of about 70. These Quakers have no leader;very simple meetings;collection is always for a different charity and they always try to speak the truth. Originally the {Wesleyan Methodist {Chapel}at Pillmoss Lane was one or two cottages which were bought in 1802 for 2 shillings. It's one of the oldest chapels in the county of Cheshire in constant use. There are 25-30 regular attenders and 15 in the Sunday School.
